title: Cumberland rum Nicky
description: This traditional northern treat is a real favourite of mine. It’s stuffed with sticky dates and treacly brown sugar and laced with ginger and rum. ‘Nicky’ may stem from the original technique of covering the filling with a whole piece of pastry then making slashes or ‘nicks’ in it.Equipment and preparation: for this recipe you will need a 20cm/8in metal pie dish, about 3cm/1¼in deep.
ingredients: 50g/2oz stem ginger in syrup, drained and finely chopped
100g/3½oz unsalted butter, chilled and cut into 1cm/½in cubes
